definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: Our radio communications have been intercepted by the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我方的無線通信被敵方竊聽了。

sentences.english: The closure was announced last week as the paper was caught up in a phone hacking scandal.
sentences.chinese: 該集團因電話竊聽門而於上星期宣佈關閉。

sentences.english: It emerged in July that Milly Dowler's mobile phone had been hacked after her death.
sentences.chinese: 七月時米莉多樂的手機在她死後遭到竊聽。

sentences.english: The bulk of the railroad workers voted to go back to work.
sentences.chinese: 大多數鐵路工人投票義馬市竊聽器同意規復事變。

sentences.english: Eavesdrop on the conversation between Mrs. Greenleaf and her henchman.
sentences.chinese: 竊聽與夫人和她的劊子手格林裏夫交談。

sentences.english: He heard that they were planning to bug his office.
sentences.chinese: 他聽說他們正計劃在他的辦公室裏裝竊聽器。

sentences.english: Such as wiretapping mode called "sniffer base on intermix mode".
sentences.chinese: 這種竊聽方式爲“基於混雜模式的嗅探”。

sentences.english: Did you watch the new movie called Overheard performed by Louis Ko…
sentences.chinese: 看過古天樂的新電影《竊聽風雲》了嗎？

sentences.english: All the bugs were spotted at their suitable positions.
sentences.chinese: 所有的竊聽器都安置到適當隱蔽的位置上了。

sentences.english: Ms. Brooks was arrested Sunday on suspicion of phone hacking and making corrupt payments to police.
sentences.chinese: 布魯克斯因涉嫌電話竊聽和賄賂警察而於週日被捕。
他們在美國大使館安裝竊聽器。

sentences.english: She suspected the phone had been bugged.
sentences.chinese: 她懷疑她的電話已被竊聽了。

sentences.english: He's afraid to tell them because he suspects their phones may be bugged.
sentences.chinese: 他不敢告訴他們是因爲懷疑他們的電話可能會被竊聽。

sentences.english: We hushed, raised our eyebrows and leaned closer to eavesdrop better.
sentences.chinese: 我們靜靜地坐着，擡起頭斜身靠近以便能更好的竊聽。

sentences.english: They replied that they could find no evidence of authorized wiretapping in their files.
sentences.chinese: 他們回答說檔案中沒有任何關於授權竊聽的證據。

sentences.english: Equipped with tapping system, double speed motor.
sentences.chinese: 配有竊聽系統，雙速電機。

definition: abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
Edward Snowden (1983-), American surveillance program whistleblower
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
